BR_text.BRdescription:
When a dataset of roughly 26000 images was created, annotator took ~5 seconds to load a single image (saying 'loading annotations').
 Browser:
 Firefox 65.0.1 (64-bit), Ubuntu 18.04
 Coco annotator docker image version 0.8.0.
 Dataset info:
 26000 images of resolution 270x320 pixels

comments_0.comment_text:
Causes is from getting <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jsbroks/coco-annotator/blob/181caecaeffc9dc80ce611ca0b7636062f4bc784/app/api/annotator.py#L130>next a previous</denchmark-link>
 . Does anyone know a better way to do this?

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/deep-jkl>@deep-jkl</denchmark-link>
  Could you check the latest build to see if the issue is fixed. I don't have a 26k dataset to test this on.

comments_2.comment_text:
Hi,
 sorry for the long delay, I have pulled newest image from dockerhub, the loading is now fine, but thumbnails are not shown, is this a feature or shall I fire another issue?

comments_3.comment_text: Yes, but please provide as much information as possible since Im not having this this problem

comments_4.comment_text:
I've created new issue with more info <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jsbroks/coco-annotator/issues/170>#170</denchmark-link>
 . Thanks.
